subtitle: in two volumes : being a collection of precedents, by bill and answer, plea and demurrer, in causes of the greatest moment (wherein equity hath been allowed) which have been commenced in the High Court of Chancery, for more than 30 years last past : with appeals (in several cases of great difficulty) to the House of Peers in Parliament, and the proceedings thereupon : also a compleat colection of all the writs and process concerning the same, together with a praeliminary discourse, by way of rules, succinctly and methodically drawn up, containing the practice of the said court, in every  particular branch of the equitable part thereof.
contributions: Thomas Jefferson Library Collection (Library of Congress)
title: Praxis almae curiae cancellariae
subjects: Equity pleading and procedure -- Great Britain -- Early works to 1800
publishers: Printed by J. Nutt, assignee of Edward Sayer Esq. for Abel Roper, and Samuel Butler ...

notes.value:
"By William Brown"--T.p. of v. 2.

Sometimes attributed to Sir Robert Heath. Cf. Halkett & Laing.

Vol. 1: [8], 576 p.; v. 2: [8], 103, [1]; 176; 401-720, [40] p.

ESTC T97046

Sowerby, E.M.  Cat. of the lib. of Thomas Jefferson, 1734

LC copy signed by former owner Elihu Hall Bay; with bookplate of James Louis Petigrul.
